listing_details: Seniority level: Entry level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Compensation Range:

$110,000 - $165,000

Welcome to IntePros, a certified woman-owned company specializing in innovative and results-oriented recruiting and staffing solutions. We take immense pride in genuinely understanding what drives and inspires exceptional individuals like you. Your success is our priority, and we are dedicated to actively shaping your long-term career journey. At IntePros, we believe in comprehensive well-being. You have access to our medical, dental, vision, and mental health programs, ensuring your health and wellness are taken care of. To support your continuous growth, we also provide a $1,500 per year education and professional certification fund. Diversity and inclusion are cornerstones of our company ethos. IntePros is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran or military status, retaliation, or any other characteristic protected by law. We celebrate the rich tapestry of backgrounds and perspectives that make us stronger as a team. Please note that only qualified individuals being considered will be contacted. We appreciate your interest and look forward to potentially embarking on a transformative journey together.

We were founded to radically improve spacecraft affordability and reliability, transforming, and enabling next-generation space mission operations worldwide. Today, we are one of the most innovative aerospace companies, specializing in end-to-end customer solutions and the rapid production of spacecraft platforms. Our complete Space Segment Solution includes spacecraft production, payload integration, system integration & test, launch services, ground segment services, and mission operations, enabling customers to leverage our existing technology solutions to get to orbit rapidly and responsively. We’re looking to expand our team across the board.

We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic DevOps Engineer with

experience in both cloud and on-premises software development environments and

delivery. As a DevOps Engineer with the SRE team, you will assist the senior

engineer in architecture deployment and management for York software platforms.

This role will provide primary support for the Kubernetes platform and involve

container management through Azure Kubernetes Services and Container

Registries. You will create and maintain CI/CD pipelines with TeamCity and

Gitlab runners. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative

environment and enjoys the challenge of creating elegant solutions from

complex, multi-faceted design requirements.

Responsibilities

Facilitates ongoing Kubernetes container operations and

maintenance on AzureGov cloud environment.

Create, build and code deployment pipelines with Team City and

Gitlab runners.

Identify manual processes that can be automated.

Generate ideas to improve overall system design and/or

streamline CI/CD pipeline to generate efficiencies in system flow.

Helps in development of automated testing activities for

software builds.

Participates in configuration management with Ansible and Gitlab

platforms.

Helps with system monitoring and reporting with Splunk, Azure

tools and other platforms.

Qualifications

3-5 years minimum experience with consumer-facing digital

products.

Experience with Kubernetes, Git, CI/CD, Docker, Ansible.

Coding capabilities with Bash, .net, JavaScript.

Expertise with System and Container management.

3-5 years Cloud environment experience.

Effective communication skills.

Desired Qualifications

Understanding of monitoring and logging platforms Grafana and

Azure Logging.

Experience in service reliability through Load Balancing, HA,

and micro-services.

Database experience with MySQL, MSSQL, InfluxDB.

Knowledge of security and compliance needs of cloud

environments.

Experience with Linux kernel builds for FPGAs

listing_details: Seniority level: Entry level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: Human Resources Services
description:
Role: AWS Cloud DevOps Engineer


Location: Mountain View, CA (Day one onsite)


Duration: Fulltime


Job Description


  • Level: middle (min. 5+ year of experience required)
  • Must have any cloud certification
  • We're looking for an AWS Cloud DevOps Engineer in Mountain View, CA. This position will primarily perform day to day DevOps duties.
  • As an AWS Cloud DevOps Engineer, you will be an integral part of the team responsible for delivering cloud solutions for our client. Your duties will include building and automating cloud based applications and environments using various DevOps toolsets and frameworks. You will be performing security remediation and improvements to existing infrastructure. You will also be in a position to advice clients on selecting and implementing various toolsets within their current infrastructure or implementing new automation strategies in the cloud.
  • Candidates must have excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to earn the trust of our AWS customers and partners at any level, from executive to developer. We are looking for a candidate that can help to build and grow our Cloud managed services business.
  • As an AWS Cloud Engineer, you will help to architect and design cloud automation solutions. You will help customers understand and implement application automation and cloud development strategies by engineering solutions that deliver measurable business value using ground breaking technologies in the cloud.


Responsibilities


  • Provide leadership and direction of a small DevOps team while primarily working as a DevOps Engineer
  • Improve and or remediate existing AWS accounts infrastructure and resources
  • Migrate enterprise workloads to AWS using industry standard as well as proprietary methodologies
  • Automate cloud deployments, as well as build CI/CD pipeline to support cloud based workloads
  • Provide experienced knowledge and/or develop competency on Terraform, Ansible, Cloud native automation tools
  • Stay on top of the latest trends and develop expertise in emerging cloud technologies


Requirements/Qualifications


  • Minimum of 5 years of experience. You have DevOps/Automation experience on Amazon AWS
  • Cloud: Amazon AWS, AWS Marketplace, PaaS, IaaS, SaaS
  • Platforms and tools: Jenkins, Artifactory, Python, Bash and other scripting languages
  • DevOps/Automation: Terraform, OpsWorks, CloudFormation, Ansible, Chef, Puppet
  • Cloud certifications are required; Cloud Solutions Architect-Associate level or above and AWS Specialty certifications
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft applications including Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, and Excel
  • Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

listing_details: Seniority level: Entry level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
Job Description

We are seeking a DevOps Engineer (Entry Level) to join our team! You will design and develop solutions to complex application problems or network concerns.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee the installation of operating systems, network systems, software, and hardware
  • Monitor system operations to detect potential problems
  • Implement network systems to support communication between all departments
  • Provide technical direction and guidance to team members
  • Provide quality assurance review of new and existing software products

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in computer engineering, architecture, or other related fields
  • Fundamental knowledge of networking, hardware, and software
  • Strong troubleshooting and critical thinking skills
  • Ability to prioritize and multitask
  • Deadline and detail-oriented

Company Description

Magnus Technology Solutions provide quick orientation / training for professionals & placement for candidates having work authorization in USA. We work on #Selenium, #QA_Testing, #QA_Automation, #Manual_Testing #Dotnet, #java, #j2ee, #java_UI, #Angular, #React, #Python, #DevOps, #Salesforce, #Hadoop, #IOS, #Android, #RPA, #Mulesoft and any #Developer related #Technologies.

listing_details: Seniority level: Mid-Senior level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Analyst and Information Technology, Industries: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
Our client, located in Phoenix, AZ is looking for a junior level DevOps Engineer (AWS or Azure) on a contract to hire basis.

Note:

· This is role looking for 2+ years of DevOps experience with either AWS or Azure

· Must be local to Phoenix, AZ market (2-3 days onsite per Month)

· Client unable to provide sponsorship (Must be US Citizen or GC holder)

Duties and Required skills

· Serves as a DevOps Engineer supporting a dedicated DevOps team. This role will be responsible for applying DevOps best practices and ideas to include testability, repeatability, and automation, and be able to provide skill uplift, knowledge transfer and sharing of DevOps concepts and best practices to various agile team members.

· Design, build and maintain the CI/CD infrastructure and tools using Jenkins

· Leverage CI/CD tools to automate testing and deployment

· 2+ years of DevOps experience with AWS Or Azure

· Configuration Management experience using Chef

· Experience with Terraform for infrastructure automation

· Ability to create CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins

listing_details: Seniority level: Entry level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: Public Safety
description:
Description

Elevator Pitch:

Are you interested in a breadth of technologies from IoT computer systems to the Cloud? Evolv is looking for a DevOps Engineer to expand the skills of the team and help scale our development and test environment capabilities. You will be working with tools such as Terraform, Python, Docker, CircleCI, JFrog, Veracode and AWS. In this role you will be an expert at helping the team with optimizing their builds, writing infrastructure as code to deploy testing infrastructure to AWS, investigating software dependencies for security and compliance vulnerabilities, and launching new products.

Success in the Role: What are performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?

In The First 30 Days, You Will

  • Participate in “EvolvED”, a week-long orientation program for all new employees
  • Familiarize yourself with the CI/CD platform and build pipelines.
  • Meet with key stakeholders from across Software Development and Quality.
  • Develop an understanding of team needs and goals.
  • Be an active participant in a software release.

Within 3 Months, You Will

  • Help optimize the management of software artifacts.
  • Increase the automation and monitoring of software releases.
  • Provide guidance to the team on triaging security and compliance scans.
  • Be a reliable resource for developers.
  • Assist developers triage Security scan results.

By The End Of The First Year, You Will

  • Be an expert with the CI/CD platform.
  • Lead initiatives to explore new tools and technologies.
  • Be comfortable refactoring build pipelines and deploying test infrastructure.
  • Take ownership of multiple build pipelines and projects.
  • Aid in Security monitoring and reporting efforts to obtain company certifications.

The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

CI/CD Specialist

  • Write and review YAML configuration as code for build pipelines.
  • Work with teams to identify requirements and translate them into a build process, understanding the options available to best achieve their goals.
  • Optimize build pipelines to ensure costs remain aligned with growth.
  • Automate artifact management to promote a Continuous Delivery platform.

Infrastructure As Code

  • Develop Dockerfiles for build containers.
  • Develop Terraform for the deployment of build and test infrastructure to AWS.
  • Develop Python code to provide internal tooling to developers and release managers.
  • Develop reusable CI/CD pipelines to standardize team workflows.

Security & Compliance

  • Extend security and compliance scanning into the developer environment to proactively address risks.
  • Lead in the triaging of risks and aid developers with resolutions.
  • Provide reports and metrics to aid management in certification processes.

Platform Engineering

  • Extend internal tools to streamline the release process.
  • Provide metrics for developers and quality assurance to empower Continuous Delivery of software.
  • Develop self-service infrastructure to enable test environments.

What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team?

You will be joining the growing DevOps team in the Software Organization and reports to the DevOps Architect.

The team culture is one based on building trust, collaboration, on-going development through kindness, authenticity, courage, drive and fun!

Where is the role located?

This role is based out of our HQ in Waltham, MA with some flexibility in being remote some days.

What is the salary range?

The base salary range for this full-time position is $119,000-$191,000+ equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in role posting reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits.

Benefits

If you want to solve one of the most difficult issues of our time and save lives doing it, you want to work at Evolv. We are passionate, knowing that what we do and how we do it can affect life or death situations for our customers. At Evolv, you will have unparalleled exposure to all aspects of our business, working with a talented team that shares our vision for a safer world. If you are inspired by invention and gain satisfaction from seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture, Evolv will be a great fit.

  • Equity is an important component of every compensation package
  • Flexible work environment
  • Unique culture
  • Medical and dental insurance
  • 401(k) plan
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • $300 per quarter to spend on the perks that are most meaningful to you
  • Tuition Reimbursement

Evolv Technology (“Evolv”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace, and all employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where we operate. Evolv will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

Evolv is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation as part of the job application process, please connect with us at careers@evolvtechnology.com.
